intro: Huxleya, commonly known as the "ice plant" or "desert rose," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Aizoaceae. These succulent plants are native to arid regions of southern Africa, where they thrive in hot, dry climates. Huxleya species are characterized by their fleshy, often blue or purple-tinted leaves and showy, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of yellow, orange, or red. They are well adapted to drought conditions, storing water in their thick leaves and stems. Due to their striking appearance and low maintenance requirements, Huxleya plants are popular among succulent enthusiasts and are often cultivated in rock gardens or as container plants.
